resources.string: Cognitive Measures

The following are a series of cognitive tasks, several of which are the versions of the tasks you completed in the original Project Talent study.

 	• Read the instructions for each task carefully.
 	• Do the best you can. If you are unsure of the right answer, pick the one you think is the best.
 	• If a task includes multiple-choice questions, select only one answer.
 	• There is only one right answer for each question.

 Press the NEXT button to begin the first task.

You have completed the puzzles.

 IMPORTANT! Please press "Finish" to be sure all of your answers are saved.

 Once you press "Finish" the program will close. Press the droidSURVEY button to complete the survey questions.
Begin
Back
Finish
INSTRUCTIONS\n\n This task contains words for you to define. The items are multiple choice - select the best response for each word.
Vocabulary
Number Series

plurals.name: ns_instr
plurals.item: Please enter the number that belongs in the empty box. The answer will be a number between 0 and 99.
Please enter the number that belongs in the empty boxes. The answer will be a number between 0 and 99.

resources.string: Example 2 Answer

INSTRUCTIONS

 • You will now see six more questions like the ones you just did.
 • Please enter the number that belongs in each empty box.
 • An empty box could be at the end of a series or it could be in the middle or at the beginning.
 • You may be asked a question with more than one empty box in the sequence.
 • The numbers might increase, like 2, 4, 6, or decrease, like 6, 4, 2.
 • Some of the questions may be easy but others may be hard. Just do the best you can.
 • It is more important to answer the item correctly than to answer quickly, so take a little time to think before answering.
 • In a few cases, more than one number may be correct. Please give only one answer per box. If your answer is one of the correct answers, you will receive credit.
 • You can go on to the next item at any time by pressing 'Next'.

 If you are ready to begin, please press 'Next'.
Undo
Please press \"Next\" to continue.

{ "id": 1, "question": "INSTRUCTIONS

 In this task, on each screen you will be presented with several numbers that make up a series. There will be one or more empty boxes somewhere in the series. Sometimes an empty box will be at the end of the series, sometimes in the middle, and sometimes at the beginning. Please tap the number buttons to enter the number that goes into each empty box. The answer will be a number between 0 and 99.

 Here is an example.", "options": [1, 2, 3, 4], "ansPosition": 2, "answerText": "INSTRUCTIONS

The answer we were looking for is 3, so the completed sequence is:" }

{ "id": 2, "question": "INSTRUCTIONS

Below is another example.
Please enter the number that belongs in each empty box. The answer will be a number between 0 and 99.", "options": [2, 4, 6, 8], "ansPosition": 3, "answerText": "INSTRUCTIONS

The answer we were looking for is 8 because the numbers (2, 4, 6, 8) increase by 2. The completed sequence is:" }
Abstract Reasoning
INSTRUCTIONS\n\n Each item in this task consists of a set of figures arranged in a pattern, formed according to certain rules. Look at the following patterns in example.

The question mark (?) in the lower right corner of the box shows where a figure is missing in the pattern. You are to decide which of the five figures (A, B, C, D or E) under the pattern belongs where the \"?\" is.\n\n Please press \"Next\" to continue.

In the case of the example, the figure in the bottom left is larger than the one above it but otherwise same. In the top row, the figure at the right is the same as the one to the left of it except that it has been turned upside down. Following these rules, the missing figure should be larger than the one above it, and exactly the same size as the one to the left of it, but upside down. Therefore, E is the answer to this question.\n\n Please press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS

In each question, you are to decide what figure belongs where the "?" is in the pattern. To do this you have to figure out what the rule is according to which the drawings change, going from row to row, and what the rule is for the changes going from column to column. The items have different kinds of patterns and different rules by which the drawings change.

Please press "Next" to continue.
Would you like to see another example, or are you ready to start this task?
Another example
Start task

Please see the next example. Going from left to right, the circles get larger, and going from top to bottom they get darker. Therefore the answer has to be a circle which is the largest of the three sizes, and the darkest. Choices C and E are both the right size, but E is the only large circle with the correct shading. Thus E is the only drawing that fits in the pattern formed by the other circles. E is the answer that should be chosen.\n\n Please press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS

Now look at another example, which is quite different from either of the previous ones.

 Choose the figure that belongs at "?" below, then press "Next" to continue.

What is the missing figure here? If you study the pattern you will see that going from left to right there is one more line in each figure than in the one to the left of it. Going from top to bottom, the number of lines in any figure is one less than in the figure just above it. Therefore, the missing figure should have three lines. The answer is choice C (the three lines, slanting in the proper direction).\n\n Please press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS

 • You will now be asked six more questions like the ones you just did. 
 • For each question, decide what rules the pattern follows. Choose the answer that belongs in "?" by tapping on the answer.
 • Many of the patterns are based on rules that are different from the ones in the sample items.
 • Do not spend too much time on any one question. 

 If you are ready to begin, please press "Next".
Start Now
Choose which figure belongs at the \"?\" by pressing the correct figure below. Then press \"Next\" to continue.
INSTRUCTIONS\n\nLook at the drawings below. The first drawing is shaped like the letter L. The rest of the drawings are like the first, except that they have been turned in different directions.
Please press \"Next\" to continue.

If you think of the drawing at the left below as being made out of wire and lying on a table, the positions shown in each of the other four drawings could be taken simply by turning the wire figure at the left around, without lifting it off the table. \n\n Please press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS\n\nNow look at the next row of drawings. The first drawing is shaped like the letter P. But even if the rest of the drawings were turned (rotated), they would still be backwards; you would have to lift the figure at the left off the table and flip it over to make any of the other figures.

INSTRUCTIONS

In this task each question has one drawing at the left and five similar drawings to the right of it but only one of the five drawings on the right exactly matches the drawing at the left if you turn it around. The rest of the drawings are backwards even when they are turned around. 

Please press "Next" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS

Now look at the sample question below.
Which one of the choices, when turned around, exactly matches the diagram at the left?

INSTRUCTIONS\n\nYou should have picked the fourth answer choice. All of the other choices have been \"lifted off the table and flipped over\" as well as turned around, and thus are backwards. For the sample question, the fourth answer has been selected.
For each question in this task, choose the one drawing which, when turned around or rotated, is exactly like the basic drawing at the left.\n\n If you are ready to begin, please press \"Next\".
Choose the one drawing which, when turned (rotated), exactly matches the drawing at the left.
Quit

Thurstone

Exit

In this test you will be presented with a fixation cross, followed by a red circle.
Your task is to
(1) Concentrate on the fixation cross
(2) press the SPACEBAR as soon as possible once the red circle is presented.
(press SPACEBAR below to continue)
